definitions: slow movement of liquid through porous material or small openings
examples: Water seepage through the basement walls created persistent dampness problems
The dam engineers monitored seepage rates during the rainy season

definitions: person who claims or appears to see or predict future events
unit of weight used in India, typically about one kilogram
examples: The ancient seer prophesied seven years of drought would follow
Village elders consulted the seer before making important decisions
Rice prices rose to fifty rupees per seer in the market
The merchant weighed out three seers of wheat flour

definitions: board balanced on a central fulcrum for children to ride up and down
situation or movement that alternates between opposite states or positions
examples: Children played on the seesaw during their recess break
The old wooden seesaw creaked under their combined weight
Stock prices continued their seesaw pattern throughout the volatile trading week
The seesaw battle lasted until the final whistle

definitions: distinct section or portion of something larger that is divided or marked off
part of a geometric figure cut off by a line or plane
separate portion of a broadcast program or recording
examples: Each segment of the orange contains seeds and juice sacs
The market research divided consumers into distinct demographic segments
Calculate the area of the circular segment between the chord and arc
The line segment connects points A and B directly
Tonight's news segment focuses on local environmental issues
The comedy show's opening segment featured celebrity interviews

definitions: action of dividing something into segments or distinct parts
division of an organism or embryo into a series of similar parts
dividing a market into distinct groups of buyers with different needs
examples: Image segmentation helps computers identify objects in digital photographs
The segmentation of the project into phases improved management efficiency
Segmentation begins early in embryonic development of most animals
The earthworm's body shows clear segmentation into repeated units
Market segmentation allows companies to target specific consumer groups effectively
Geographic segmentation divides customers based on their location

definitions: person or thing that has been set apart or isolated from others
examples: The segregate population showed distinct genetic characteristics after generations of isolation
Each segregate was studied individually to understand mutation patterns

definitions: enforced separation of different racial or social groups in daily life
separation of pairs of alleles during meiosis in sexual reproduction
examples: Racial segregation in schools was declared unconstitutional in 1954
The civil rights movement fought against segregation in public facilities
Mendel's law describes the segregation of genetic factors during reproduction
Chromosomal segregation ensures each gamete receives one copy of each chromosome

definitions: person who believes in or supports the enforced separation of different racial groups
examples: Segregationists opposed the integration of public schools during the 1960s
The governor was known as a staunch segregationist throughout his political career

definitions: smooth transition from one topic, scene, or musical piece to another without pause
examples: The DJ created a perfect segue between the two dance tracks
Her speech included a clever segue from education policy to healthcare

definitions: large fishing net that hangs vertically in water with floats and weights
examples: Fishermen hauled the heavy seine onto the beach filled with sardines
The seine net stretched across the entire width of the inlet

definitions: scientific study of earthquakes and the propagation of elastic waves through Earth
examples: Modern seismology helps predict potential earthquake zones and intensities
She earned her doctorate in seismology from the university

definitions: act of taking hold of something suddenly and forcibly
binding with turns of small rope or wire
examples: The seizing of enemy assets began immediately after war was declared
His sudden seizing of her arm startled everyone present
The sailor demonstrated proper seizing technique on the ship's rigging
Wire seizing prevented the cable from unraveling

definitions: action of capturing someone or something using force
sudden attack of illness, especially stroke or epileptic fit
official taking of property by legal authority
examples: The seizure of the embassy sparked an international crisis
Armed forces completed their seizure of the capital city
The patient experienced multiple seizures requiring immediate medical attention
Epileptic seizures can vary greatly in severity and symptoms
Drug enforcement conducted the largest seizure of narcotics in state history
Asset seizure laws allow police to confiscate suspected criminal proceeds

definitions: action or process of carefully choosing something as being the best
range of things from which a choice may be made
process by which certain traits become more prevalent in populations
examples: The selection of jury members took three days to complete
Her selection as team captain surprised many observers
The store offers an excellent selection of organic produce
Browse our selection of winter coats now on sale
Natural selection favors traits that enhance survival and reproduction
Artificial selection produced modern dog breeds from wolves

definitions: quality of carefully choosing only the best or most suitable
ability of a device or system to respond to specific signals while rejecting others
examples: The university's selectivity increased as application numbers grew
Their selectivity in hiring ensures only top candidates join the team
Radio receiver selectivity prevents interference from adjacent stations
The filter's selectivity determines which wavelengths pass through

definitions: elected member of a board of officials governing a New England town
examples: The board of selectmen voted to approve the new town budget
She served as selectman for three consecutive terms

definitions: person who selects or chooses members of a team or group
mechanical device for selecting specific gears or functions
code element that identifies which HTML elements to style
examples: The national team selector announced the squad for the tournament
Selectors faced criticism for omitting several star players
Move the gear selector to park before turning off the engine
The selector switch allows you to choose between different modes
CSS selectors target specific elements for styling on web pages
The class selector applies styles to all matching elements

definitions: person's essential being that distinguishes them from others
particular nature or personality of an individual
examples: Meditation helps you connect with your inner self
She struggled to maintain her sense of self during the crisis
His true self emerged only among close friends
The book explores the nature of self and consciousness

definitions: act or instance of selling something to a buyer
attempt to persuade someone of the merits of something
examples: The sell of company shares requires board approval
That was a tough sell to skeptical investors
His enthusiastic sell of the proposal convinced the committee
The hard sell tactics alienated potential customers

definitions: person or business that sells goods or services
product that sells in specified amounts or ways
examples: The seller agreed to lower the asking price by ten percent
Online sellers must comply with consumer protection laws
The novel became an instant best seller worldwide
This model has been a consistent seller for five years

definitions: action of transferring goods or services in exchange for money
process of persuading someone to accept or approve something
examples: Online selling has transformed retail business models globally
Her selling of handmade jewelry supports her family
The selling of the new policy required extensive public relations
Effective selling involves understanding customer needs

definitions: act of betraying one's principles or cause for personal gain
event or performance for which all tickets are sold
person who compromises their integrity for profit or advantage
examples: Critics called the compromise a sellout to corporate interests
The artist's commercial turn felt like a sellout to fans
Tonight's concert is a complete sellout with no tickets remaining
The championship game was a sellout three weeks in advance
They branded him a sellout for joining the rival company
Many viewed the politician as a sellout after changing positions

definitions: carbonated water, either plain or flavored, used as a beverage or mixer
examples: She ordered a plain seltzer with lime instead of soda
The bartender used seltzer to make the cocktail lighter

definitions: system of visual signaling using flags, lights, or mechanical arms
synchronization mechanism that controls access to shared resources in computing
examples: Railroad semaphore signals indicated whether tracks were clear
Ships communicated using semaphore flags before radio was common
The semaphore prevents multiple threads from accessing the critical section simultaneously
Database semaphores manage concurrent access to shared data

definitions: outward appearance or apparent form of something, especially when misleading or superficial
examples: She maintained a semblance of normalcy despite the family crisis
The meeting preserved some semblance of democratic process

definitions: half of an academic year, typically lasting fifteen to eighteen weeks
examples: Students must complete four courses each semester to graduate on time
The fall semester begins in late August at most universities

definitions: large truck consisting of a tractor unit and trailer
house joined to another house on one side only
something that is partial or half of something
examples: The semi jackknifed on the icy highway causing major delays
She earned her commercial license to drive semis cross-country
They bought a semi in the suburbs with a nice garden
The semi next door has been for sale for months
The team reached the semi but lost in penalty kicks
He owns a semi-detached property near the station

definitions: firearm that automatically reloads but fires one shot per trigger pull
examples: The semiautomatic rifle requires manual trigger pulls for each shot
Police recovered several semiautomatic weapons during the raid

definitions: half of a circle or something arranged in the shape of half a circle
examples: Students sat in a semicircle around the teacher for story time
The semicircle has a diameter of ten meters

definitions: punctuation mark (;) indicating a pause greater than a comma but less than a period
examples: Use a semicolon to separate independent clauses in a compound sentence
The semicolon connects related ideas without using a conjunction

definitions: material with electrical conductivity between that of conductors and insulators, used in electronic devices
examples: Silicon semiconductors form the basis of modern computer chips
The semiconductor industry drives much of technological innovation

definitions: match or round immediately before the final in a competition or tournament
examples: Both semifinals will be played on Saturday with the final on Sunday
They lost in the semifinal after a dramatic penalty shootout

definitions: competitor who has reached the semifinal round of a competition
examples: Four semifinalists remain in the tennis championship
She was named a semifinalist for the prestigious scholarship

definitions: conference or meeting for discussion or training on a specific subject
small group class at a university for discussion and research
examples: The business seminar covered new marketing strategies and trends
Attendance at the safety seminar is mandatory for all employees
Graduate students present their research in the weekly seminar
The philosophy seminar meets twice weekly for intensive discussion

definitions: student training to become a priest, minister, or rabbi at a seminary
examples: The seminarian spent his summer working in a rural parish
Seminarians study theology, philosophy, and pastoral care

definitions: training college for priests, ministers, or rabbis
examples: He entered the seminary after completing his undergraduate degree
The seminary offers both residential and online theology programs

definitions: smallest musical interval commonly used in Western tonal music, half of a whole tone
examples: The semitone between E and F creates harmonic tension
Chromatic scales proceed entirely by semitone intervals

definitions: coarse flour made from durum wheat, used in making pasta and puddings
examples: Traditional Italian pasta is made from semolina and water
She prepared semolina pudding with raisins for dessert

definitions: monetary unit equal to one hundredth of various Asian currencies
examples: The price increased by fifty sen since last month
One ringgit equals one hundred sen in Malaysian currency

definitions: upper house of legislature in various countries including the United States
governing body in some universities responsible for academic matters
examples: The senate voted to approve the new healthcare legislation
She won her senate seat by a narrow margin
The university senate approved changes to the graduation requirements
Faculty representatives serve three-year terms on the academic senate

definitions: member of a senate, especially of the upper house of the US Congress
examples: The senator introduced legislation to reform immigration policy
Both senators from the state opposed the trade agreement

definitions: person or entity who sends a message, letter, package, or transmission
examples: The sender forgot to include a return address on the package
Email systems verify the sender's identity to prevent spam

definitions: action of causing something to go or be taken to a destination
examples: The sending of troops to the region escalated tensions
Automated sending of invoices saves considerable administrative time

definitions: biological process of growing old or the condition resulting from gradual deterioration
examples: Cellular senescence prevents damaged cells from dividing further
Plant senescence involves the yellowing and dropping of leaves

definitions: person who is older or has higher rank than someone else
student in the final year of high school or college
person holding a higher or more important position
examples: Seniors receive discounts at many restaurants and theaters
The retirement community provides activities specifically for seniors
High school seniors submitted their college applications in December
The senior class organized the graduation ceremony
She was promoted to senior vice president last year
Senior management approved the merger proposal

definitions: state of being older or having served longer, giving priority or advantage
examples: Seniority determines vacation scheduling in many union contracts
Her seniority at the company earned her the corner office

definitions: tropical plant whose dried leaves or pods are used as a laxative
examples: Senna tea is commonly used to treat occasional constipation
The herbalist recommended senna pods for digestive relief

definitions: physical feeling or perception from stimulation of a sense organ
widespread reaction of interest or excitement
person or thing that causes great public interest
examples: A tingling sensation spread through her fingertips
The medication may cause sensations of dizziness or nausea
The scandal created a sensation in the media
Her debut novel became an overnight sensation
The young singer was the sensation of the music festival
The new restaurant has become the sensation of the neighborhood

definitions: use of exciting or shocking stories at the expense of accuracy to provoke interest
examples: The tabloid's sensationalism attracted readers but damaged its credibility
Critics accused the documentary of sensationalism rather than serious journalism

definitions: person who presents stories in an exaggerated way to create public interest
examples: The sensationalist reporter was criticized for distorting facts
Television sensationalists often prioritize ratings over accuracy
